node.rawMarkdownBody:
- Designing and building a Wordpress travel vlog website
- Designing a Mailchimp marketing campaign for an online Organic Health & Makeup store
- Customising Wordpress landing page for a Meditation & Health consultation service
- Customising Wordpress site for an online Kids' Clothing online store
- Contributing to testing of new websites and mobile app designs for various clients

- Contributed to quality and testing processes within the Confluence Integration, Customer organisations, and Approvals features of JIRA Service Desk through QA Kickoffs, Demos, Blitz testing, Product Tours and manual testing
- Contributing to testing of Customer organisations to Service Desk Cloud, Atlassian's most requested feature at the time (with over 1300 watchers on JIRA ticket JSD-270).

frontmatter.title: QA Analyst
frontmatter.tech: Javascript (ES6), Cypress, Web Accessibility, PHP, PHPUnit, CharlesProxy, Wireshark, React

node.rawMarkdownBody:
- Set up and currently maintain e2e Test Automation suites for Web platform and Login web service with Cypress and Javascript from scratch, plus integrate the suite into Bitbucket Pipelines for continuous testing. This has has helped identify critical bugs and issues during refactoring and player upgrades
- Helped build and currently maintain an e2e API Integration Test Suite using PHPUnit which has saved hours typically taken for manual regression tests
- Pair with other QAs, developers, business analysts and product owners to find ways of testing stories and bugfixes across a wide range of web, mobile, connected TV and set top box platforms 
- Investigate major incidents and customer problems, which includes debugging with Chrome DevTools, Postman, Wireshark and CharlesProxy
- Conduct pre-certification testing on Web and Mobile platforms, including OzTAM
- Code the occasional small bugfix (with tests!)
- Dancing on the SBS Mardi Gras float and running as part of the SBS/Broadcast Australia team in the Sydney Running Festival

This is 3-year fast track degree with a focus on Computer Information Systems and Management. In parallel to study I also had the opportunity to take part in two six month full-time industry placements. I worked at:
- IBM Australia
- Commonwealth Bank
[More information about the UTS Bachelor of Information Technology Program](https://www.uts.edu.au/about/faculty-engineering-and-information-technology/bachelor-information-technology-co-operative-scholarship)

[freeCodeCamp](https://www.freecodecamp.org/) is a nonprofit global online community which provides a open source curriculum for learning how to code.
My study involved over 400 hours of coursework which included:
- introduction and intermediate HTML and CSS
- introduction to Javascript
- basic and intermediate algorithm scripting
- web development projects in Javascript, including:
 - Javascript Calculator
 - Pomodoro Timer
 - Tic Tac Toe Game
 - Simon Game
[My Front End Web Development Certificate](https://www.freecodecamp.com/alexhippo/front-end-certification)

[Bushwalking NSW](https://www.bushwalkingnsw.org.au/) is the peak body for bushwalkers in NSW and the ACT. It represents the interests of over 12,000 bushwalkers from over 70 bushwalking clubs throughout the state, and provides a united voice to local, state and federal government agencies and other bodies on issues affecting bushwalkers.

I was responsible for all things web administration and development. Tasks I've worked on include:
- data migration of over 600 members to Mailchimp
- designing and managing Mailchimp email marketing campaigns
- executing site upgrades
